KING DADDY (THE ALBUM)|author=Daddy Yankee|publisher=Instagram|type=Post|language=Spanish|date=March 31, 2016|accessdate=December 2, 2016}}{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/BEqB7vFLK2q/?taken-by=daddyyankee|title=#KingDaddy|author=Daddy Yankee|publisher=Instagram|type=Post|date=April 26, 2016|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} | venue = | studio = {{Collapsible list|title=Various|titlestyle=font-weight:normal;font-size:12px;background:transparent;text-align:left {{Bulleted list|[[El Cartel Records]]
{{small|([[Santurce, San Juan, Puerto Rico]])}}|[[Criteria Studios]]{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/BEvvYdWmXQX/|title=Daddy Yankee recording vocals at Criteria Studios' control room|publisher=instagram.com|date=April 28, 2016|accessdate=October 6, 2016}}
{{small|([[Miami]], [[Florida]], [[United States]]}})|Music Capos Studios{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/0oRuU_LK3A/|title=Daddy Yankee working on ''King Daddy II'' at Chris Jeday's Studio|publisher=instagram.com|language=spanish|date=March 24, 2015|accessdate=October 20, 2016}}
{{small|(San Juan, Puerto Rico)}}|Master House Studios{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/BCGM29Ul6q4/|title=Daddy Yankee and Chris Jeday working on ''King Daddy II'' at Master House Studios|publisher=instagram.com|date=February 22, 2016|accessdate=October 20, 2016}}
{{small|([[Doral, Florida]], United States)}}}}}} | genre = [[Reggaeton]] | length = | label = [[El Cartel Records|El Cartel]] | producer = {{hlist|Chris Jeday|Gaby Music|Jumbo|Los Evo Jedis}} | prev_title = [[El Imperio Nazza#King Daddy Edition|King Daddy]] | prev_year = 2013 | year = TBA | next_title = | next_year = | misc = {{Singles | name = El Disco Duro | type = studio | single1 = [[Sígueme y Te Sigo]] | single1date = March 12, 2015 | single2 = Vaivén | single2date = September 17, 2015 | single3 = [[Shaky Shaky]] | single3date = April 8, 2016 | single4 = [[Otra Cosa (Daddy Yankee song)|Otra Cosa]] | single4date = December 9, 2016 | single5 = [[La Rompe Corazones]] | single5date = January 6, 2017 | single6 = [[Vuelve (Daddy Yankee song)|Vuelve]] | single6date = September 29, 2017 | single7 = [[Dura (song)|Dura]] | single7date = January 18, 2018 }} }} '''''El Disco Duro''''' is the upcoming seventh studio album (fourteenth overall) by [[Puerto Ricans|Puerto Rican]] rapper [[Daddy Yankee]], originally scheduled to be released during early 2017. Its original title was ''King Daddy II: Elemento DY'', a [[sequel]] to his previous album ''[[El Imperio Nazza#King Daddy Edition|King Daddy]]'', produced by Los De La Nazza, a production duo that worked with Daddy Yankee from 2007 to 2014. The album will include "[[Sígueme y Te Sigo]]", "Vaivén" and "[[Shaky Shaky]]" as its singles, which were released between March 2015 and April 2016. Its release date has to be announced. ==Background== [[File:DaddyYankee.jpg|thumb|left|Daddy Yankee in 2006.|150px]] ''El Disco Duro'' (originally titled ''King Daddy II: Elemento DY''){{cite web |url= http://www.univision.com/puerto-rico/wkaq/daddy-yankee-se-encuentra-en-el-estudio-finalizando-su-proximo-album|title=Daddy Yankee se encuentra en el estudio finalizando su próximo álbum|trans-title=Daddy Yankee is in the studio finalizing his upcoming album|publisher=Univisión|language=Spanish|date=January 13, 2016|accessdate=August 17, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://www.elnuevoherald.com/entretenimiento/musica/article47728830.html|title=Daddy Yankee y Don Omar se van al duelo para disputarse corona del reguetón|work=[[El Nuevo Herald]]|language=Spanish|date=December 3, 2015|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} was going to be the sequel of his previous mixtape ''[[El Imperio Nazza#King Daddy Edition|King Daddy]]'', released in October 2013, which became the first digital-only Latin album that managed to rank within the top 10 on the US [[Top Latin Albums]] chart.{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin-notas/5785843/inside-daddy-yankees-digital-only-king-album|title=Inside Daddy Yankee's Digital-Only 'King' Album|work=Billboard|date=November 11, 2013|last=Cobo|first=Leila|accessdate=August 20, 2016}} Two months after the release of ''King Daddy'', Daddy Yankee announced that there was going to be a physical version of the album, with exclusive bonus tracks, planned to be released during 2014, but it was not published after all.{{cite news|url= http://www.informador.com.mx/entretenimiento/2014/506146/6/daddy-yankee-lanzara-en-formato-fisico-el-album-king-daddy.htm|title=Daddy Yankee lanzará en formato físico el álbum 'King Daddy'|publisher=informador.com.mx|language=spanish|date=January 6, 2014|accessdate=October 28, 2016}}{{cite news|url= http://www.elheraldo.hn/vida/600816-220/daddy-yankee-lanza-nuevo-disco-y-va-por-masm|title=Daddy Yankee lanza nuevo disco y va por más|work=El Heraldo|language=Spanish|date=April 7, 2014|accessdate=August 18, 2017|location=Honduras}} The Puerto Rican production duo [[Los de la Nazza]], which had been working with Daddy Yankee since 2007, left [[El Cartel Records]] and stopped being his main producers in order to focus on their careers. Chris Jeday and Gaby Music were hired as the album's main producers during late 2014. ''El Disco Duro'' was officially announced during mid-2014 as ''King Daddy II'' with the promotion of the single "Sábado Rebelde" featuring Puerto Rican duo [[Plan B (duo)|Plan B]], released on October 31.{{cite web |url= http://www.elnuevoherald.com/entretenimiento/musica/article16902242.html|title=Daddy Yankee sigue siendo el Rey|trans-title=Daddy Yankee is still the king|work=[[El Nuevo Herald]]|last=Vargas|first=Doraluz|language=Spanish|date=March 30, 2015|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} On September 10, he was urgently moved to a nearby hospital in [[Cali]], [[Colombia]], where he was set to perform later that night. Daddy Yankee suffered a rise in blood pressure, [[hypoglycemia]] and dehydration, which almost caused him to suffer a heart attack before being treated by doctors. His condition improved and he was sent to rest in his native Puerto Rico, but had to cancel other concerts in Colombia.{{cite web |url= http://www.peopleenespanol.com/article/daddy-yankee-estuvo-al-borde-del-ataque-cardiaco|title=Daddy Yankee: los problemas de salud que le llevaron al hospital|publisher=peopleenespanol.com|last=Mabry Paraíso|first=Alexander|language=spanish|date=September 13, 2016|accessdate=October 17, 2016}} On October 19, he confirmed that his hypoglycemia worsened and turned into a [[prediabetes]].{{cite web |url= http://www.elheraldo.hn/entretenimiento/1009872-466/reguetonero-daddy-yankee-confirma-grave-enfermedad|title=Reguetonero Daddy Yankee confirma grave enfermedad|publisher=eheraldo.hn|language=spanish|date=October 19, 2016|accessdate=October 20, 2016}}{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1953723-daddy-yankee-rompio-el-silencio-sobre-la-enfermedad-que-padecen-el-y-una-de-sus-hijas|title=Daddy Yankee rompió el silencio sobre la enfermedad que padecen él y una de sus hijas|publisher=lanacion.com.ar|language=spanish|date=November 5, 2016|accessdate=November 6, 2016}} In January 2017, he was featured on the reggaeton-pop single "[[Despacito]]" by Puerto Rican singer [[Luis Fonsi]].{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin/7669777/luis-fonsi-highest-debut-hot-latin-songs-chart|title=Luis Fonsi Earns His Highest Debut Ever on Hot Latin Songs Chart|work=Billboard|last=Mendizabal|first=Amaya|date=January 26, 2017|accessdate=February 26, 2017}} The song was a worldwide success, topping the charts of 45 countries, including a number 1 spot on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], the first for a primarily Spanish-language song since "[[Macarena (song)|Macarena]]" by [[Los del Río]] in 1996.{{Cite news|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7793159/luis-fonsi-daddy-yankee-despacito-justin-bieber-number-one|title=Luis Fonsi & Daddy Yankee's 'Despacito' With Justin Bieber: No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 This Week|work=Billboard|first=Gary|last=Trust|date=May 15, 2017|accessdate=May 16, 2017}} The success of the song led Daddy Yankee to become the most listened artist worldwide on the streaming service [[Spotify]] on July 9, 2017, being the first Latin artist to do so.{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/daddy-yankee-is-1-on-spotify-1st-latin-artist-to-do-so/2017/07/09/42a78bb2-64da-11e7-94ab-5b1f0ff459df_story.html|title=Daddy Yankee is #1 on Spotify; 1st Latin artist to do so|publisher=[[Washington Post]]|last=Ratner-Arias|first=Sigal|date=July 9, 2017|accessdate=July 9, 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170709221642/https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/daddy-yankee-is-1-on-spotify-1st-latin-artist-to-do-so/2017/07/09/42a78bb2-64da-11e7-94ab-5b1f0ff459df_story.html|archivedate=July 9, 2017|df=}}{{cite web |url= http://www.vibe.com/2017/07/daddy-yankee-number-1-spotify/|title=Daddy Yankee Breaks Barriers Becoming Top Streamed Artist On Spotify|publisher=[[Vibe (magazine)|Vibe]]|last=Pickens|first=Ashley|date=July 10, 2017|accessdate=July 10, 2017}} In March 2017, Daddy Yankee announced a global partnership with [[Zumba|Zumba Fitness]], in which he would record exclusive tracks for the Zumba Instructor Network.{{cite web |url= https://www.vibe.com/2017/03/daddy-yankee-zumba-fitness-hula-hoop-dance/|title=Daddy Yankee Teams Up With Zumba For "Hula Hoop" Workout|publisher=[[Vibe (magazine)|Vibe]]|last=Imarenezor|first=Christine|date=March 8, 2017|accessdate=August 19, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://zlife.zumba.com/daddy-yankee-zumba-announce-global-partnership-support-artists-new-single-hula-hoop/|title=Daddy Yankee and Zumba Announce Global Partnership in Support of Artist’s New Single "Hula Hoop"|publisher=zlife.zumba.com|date=March 3, 2017|accessdate=August 19, 2017}} On March 15, 2017, Daddy Yankee was recognized as Artist/Songwriter of the Year by the [[American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers]] during the 25th Annual ASCAP Latin Music Awards.{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin/7727807/daddy-yankee-joss-favela-ascap-latin-awards-winners|title=Daddy Yankee, Joss Favela Win Top Honors at ASCAP Latin Awards|work=Billboard|last=Cobo|first=Leila|date=March 15, 2017|accessdate=March 16, 2017}} A day later, he received a Puerto Rican Walk of Fame Star in San Juan, becoming the first urban act to do so.{{cite web |url= http://www.meridiano90.com/1829_eeuu/4402017_paseo-fama-de-puerto-rico-ya-cuenta-con-estrellas-a-reguetonero-y-deportistas.html|title=Paseo Fama de Puerto Rico ya cuenta con estrellas a reggaetonero y deportistas|publisher=meridiano90.com|language=Spanish|date=March 16, 2017|accessdate=March 16, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin/7728541/daddy-yankee-ednita-nazario-honored-puerto-rico|title=Daddy Yankee & Ednita Nazario Honored by the Puerto Rico Hall of Fame|work=Billboard|last=Fernandez|first=Suzette|date=March 17, 2017|accessdate=March 19, 2017}} ==Composition== "[[Sígueme y Te Sigo]]" is a dance love song written by Daddy Yankee, Chris Jeday and Luis "Wichi" Ortíz Rivera, inspired by [[social networks]] but not centred on them, and mixes reggaeton with Latin pop, including an electric guitar riff.{{cite web |url= http://www.vivelohoy.com/entretenimiento/8446109/video-sigueme-y-te-sigo-de-daddy-yankee|title=Sígueme Y Te Sigo, de Daddy Yankee|publisher=vivelohoy.com|language=spanish|date=May 11, 2015|accessdate=August 19, 2016}} "Vaivén" is a [[moombahton]] song written by Daddy Yankee, Luis "Wichi" Ortíz Rivera and the producer Chris Jeday. "[[Shaky Shaky]]" is a reggaeton song born as a [[Freestyle rap|freestyle]] during early December 2015, and was later recorded by the production duo Los Evo Jedis.{{cite web |url= http://www.primerahora.com/entretenimiento/farandula/nota/daddyyankeecompartesushakyshaky-1147337/|title=Daddy Yankee comparte su "Shaky Shaky"|publisher=primerahora.com|language=Spanish|date=April 11, 2016|accessdate=August 20, 2016}} According to Daddy Yankee, the main vocals were recorded in one take and the song musically mixes sounds from old and new school reggaeton.{{cite web |url= http://www.latintimes.com/daddy-yankee-shaky-shaky-premiere-5-reasons-why-you-have-watch-el-cangri-music-video-392998|title=Daddy Yankee 'Shaky Shaky' Premiere: 5 Reasons Why You Have To Watch 'El Cangri' Music Video|publisher=Latin Times|last=Valdez|first=Maria|date=July 15, 2016|accessdate=August 22, 2016}}{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin/7556771/daddy-yankee-shaky-shaky-number-1-hot-latin-songs-chart|title=Daddy Yankee Celebrates 'Shaky Shaky' Hitting No. 1 on Hot Latin Songs Chart|last=Mendizabal|first=Amaya|work=Billboard|date=October 25, 2016|accessdate=October 25, 2016}} The [[keyboard bass]] line was based on the one from the single "Murder She Wrote" by [[Chaka Demus & Pliers]], released in 1992.{{cite web |url= https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/03/arts/music/playlist-young-thug-cherry-glazerr-sylvan-esso.html|title=The Playlist: Young Thug Turns the Summer's Big Meme Into a Standout Track|publisher=nytimes.com|last1=Pareles|first1=Jon|last2=Caramanica|first2=Jon|last3=Chinen|first3=Nate|date=September 2, 2016|accessdate=September 14, 2016}} It also includes a repeating sample of a horse's neigh from [[Mel and Tim]]'s "Good Guys Only Win in the Movies" (1970), which became popular after [[Cypress Hill]]'s "[[Insane in the Brain]]" (1993).{{cite web |url= http://www.whosampled.com/sample/854/Cypress-Hill-Insane-in-the-Brain-Mel-%26-Tim-Good-Guys-Only-Win-in-the-Movies/|title=Cypress Hill's 'Insane in the Brain' sample of Mel & Tim's 'Good Guys Only Win in the Movies'|publisher=whosampled.com|accessdate=October 25, 2016}} "Otra Cosa" features Dominican singer [[Natti Natasha]] and is a fusion between reggaeton, dancehall and moombahton music written by Daddy Yankee, Natti Natasha and Puerto Rican producer Haze.{{cite web |url= http://www.univision.com/noticias/edicion-digital/daddy-yankee-y-natti-natasha-estrenan-otra-cosa-su-cancion-para-ponerle-ritmo-al-fin-de-ano-video|title=Daddy Yankee y Natti Natasha estrenan ‘Otra cosa’, su canción para ponerle ritmo al fin de año|publisher=Univisión|language=Spanish|date=December 8, 2016|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} 1:20–1:40{{cite web |url= https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Aaibwc0jF6w|title=Entrevista a Daddy Yankee y Dominicana Natti Natasha|type=Video|publisher=YouTube|language=Spanish|date=January 26, 2017|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} The lyrics are about [[lovesickness]].{{cite web |url= http://www.diariolasamericas.com/cultura/daddy-yankee-y-natti-natasha-estrenan-videoclip-otra-cosa-n4113444|title=Daddy Yankee y Natti Natasha estrenan videoclip de "Otra cosa"|trans-title=Daddy Yankee and Natti Natasha premiere "Otra Cosa" video clip|work=[[Diario Las Américas]]|language=Spanish|date=January 27, 2017|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} The concept of the song was brought to Daddy Yankee by Haze and Natti Natasha in order to be included on the track listing of ''La Super Fórmula'', a [[Pina Records]] studio album by various artists.{{cite web |url= https://www.metro.pr/pr/entretener/2016/12/09/daddy-yankee-natti-natasha-lanzan-otra-cosa.html|title=Daddy Yankee y Natti Natasha lanzan "Otra cosa"|publisher=metro.pr|language=Spanish|date=December 9, 2016|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} "La Rompe Corazones" features Puerto Rican singer Ozuna and was written by Daddy Yankee, Ozuna, Chris Jeday and Puerto Rican songwriter Jesús "Benny Benni" Benitez Hiraldo.{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/search/charts?f[0]=ss_chart_search_title%3A%22La%20Rompe%20Corazones%22&f[1]=itm_field_chart_id%3A363&refine=1|title=''Billboard'' Chart Search – La Rompe Corazones – Daddy Yankee X Ozuna – Hot Latin Songs|work=Billboard|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} The song tells the story of a lovesick woman who no longer trusts her relationships, taking revenge on other men through her frustration.{{cite web |url=http://www.daddyyankee.com/master-76|title=Daddy Yankee habla qué lo inspiró en La Rompe Corazones|publisher=daddyyankee.com|date=January 11, 2017|accessdate=January 13, 2017}} ==Production== [[File:North Miami FL Criteria Studios01.jpg|thumb|right|[[Criteria Studios]] was one of various studios the album was recorded at.|220px]] The first known recording session for ''El Disco Duro'' with producers Chris Jeday and Gaby Music was held in December 2014.{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/wL6WlQF6ux/|title=GRINDIN KING DADDY 2 ... 24 horas en el estudio y seguimos|publisher=Instagram|author1=Chris Jeday|author2=Daddy Yankee|type=Post|language=spanish|date=December 4, 2014|accessdate=April 11, 2017}} The last known session was carried out in May 2017 with the recording of the track "Percocet".{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/BE2YRkArK0V/?taken-by=daddyyankee|title=El tema controversial del album: "PERCOCET"|publisher=Instagram|author=Daddy Yankee|type=Post|language=Spanish|date=May 1, 2016|accessdate=August 17, 2017}}{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/BE3EdLBl6s4/?taken-by=chrisjeday|title=Dandole 💊💊 PERCOCET 💊💊🎼🎼 @daddyyankee @gabymusic la musa a 100|publisher=Instagram|author=Chris Jeday|type=Post|language=Spanish|date=May 1, 2016|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} The recording was resumed during mid-October 2016 with Daddy Yankee and Dominican singer [[Natti Natasha]] recording the single "Otra Cosa" for [[Pina Records]]' upcoming studio album ''La Super Fórmula''.{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/BLe-HAwhh2n/?taken-by=daddyyankee|title=Trabajando con la baby @nattinatasha 😘🌹🌹@pinarecords1|publisher=Instagram|author=Daddy Yankee|type=Post|language=spanish|date=October 12, 2016|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} However, Daddy Yankee managed to include the track on ''El Disco Duro'' during December 2016.{{cite web |url= http://www.univision.com/musica/reggaeton/exclusiva-todo-sobre-otra-cosa-la-nueva-cancion-de-daddy-yankee-y-natti-natasha|title=Exclusiva: Todo sobre 'Otra cosa', la nueva canción de Daddy Yankee y Natti Natasha|language=Spanish|publisher=Univisión|last=Vernon|first=Beatriz|date=December 7, 2016|accessdate=December 14, 2016}} On February 21, 2017, Daddy Yankee uploaded an image on his official [[Instagram]] account listening to the album.{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/BQy4NEwgLLx/?taken-by=daddyyankee|title=Studio 🎧.. Escuchando👂🏼 EL DISCO DURO 📀💿📀💿📀|publisher=Instagram|author=Daddy Yankee|type=Post|language=spanish|date=February 21, 2017|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} Studios where the album was recorded includes Daddy Yankee's El Cartel Studios in [[Santurce, San Juan, Puerto Rico]], Chris Jeday's Music Capos Studios in Puerto Rico, [[Criteria Studios]] in [[Miami, Florida, USA]], and Master House Studios in [[Doral, Florida|Doral, Florida, USA]].{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/BEvvYdWmXQX/|title=There's fire in Studio D ~courtesy of Daddy Yankee. ♨️ Some artists like to record vocals in the control room DY is one of them!|publisher=Instagram|author=Criteria Recording Studios|type=Post|date=April 28, 2016|accessdate=October 6, 2016}}{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/BCGM29Ul6q4/|title=Kd2 @daddyyankee|publisher=Instagram|author=Chris Jeday|type=Post|date=February 22, 2016|accessdate=October 20, 2016}} "Sígueme y Te Sigo" was mixed at El Cartel Studios in February 2015.{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/zPycZPF6m3/?taken-by=chrisjeday|title=MUSIC CAPOS $$$ MIXING SECTION WITH @earcandypro @daddyyankee SIGUEME Y TE SIGO|publisher=Instagram|author=Chris Jeday|type=Post|language=spanish|date=February 18, 2015|accessdate=August 17, 2017}}{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/zMvKxmF6pR/?taken-by=chrisjeday|title=Laborando con @daddyyankee @gabymusic y @earcandypro -TEMA SIGUEME Y TE SIGO|publisher=Instagram|author=Chris Jeday|type=Post|language=spanish|date=February 17, 2015|accessdate=August 17, 2017}}{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/ykkh-WF6in/?taken-by=chrisjeday|title=Tema: "SIGUEME Y TE SIGO" #KD ♊️. Bastagazo!! HIT!. Que pensaban que na' más estaba puesto pa' la calle? No confundan mi hobby con mi NEGOCIO. Atte. EL QUE SIEMPRE LES CAMBIA EL JUEGO! @daddyyankee @chrisjeday @gabymusic|publisher=Instagram|author=Daddy Yankee|type=Post|language=spanish|date=February 1, 2015|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} Sound test for "Vaivén" was held by Chris Jeday at Music Capos Studios during early August 2015.{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/6bF5xxwSkG/?taken-by=gabymusic|title=VAIVEN PRUEBA DE SONIDO DONDE TODO COMIENZA 🎹🎹🎼🎼 CREANDO MUSIC CAPOS @daddyyankee @gabymusic WORLDWIDE SOUND|publisher=Instagram|author=Chris Jeday|type=Post|language=spanish|date=August 15, 2015|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} The song was later mixed at Criteria Studios and at El Cartel Studios the same month.{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/63c1hrl6qX/?taken-by=chrisjeday|title=SIEMPRE BUSCANDO LA PERFECCION MIXING SESSION #ELVAIVEN DY @daddyyankee EN LOS CONTROLES LOS DUROS @earcandypro @gabymusic MUSIC CAPOS #ELVAIVEN WORLDWIDE SOUND|publisher=Instagram|author=Chris Jeday|type=Post|language=spanish|date=August 26, 2015|accessdate=August 17, 2017}}{{cite web |url= https://www.instagram.com/p/61U8fWF6qJ/?taken-by=chrisjeday|title=MIXING #ELVAIVEN CON @daddyyankee y @gabymusic CARTEL|publisher=Instagram|author=Chris Jeday|type=Post|language=spanish|date=August 26, 2015|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} ==Release== Daddy Yankee confirmed on October 26, 2016 during a meeting with Zumba fitness creator [[Beto Perez]] at [[Pina Records]] that ''El Disco Duro'' will be released during early 2017, most likely during January or February.{{cite web |url= http://www.univision.com/musica/reggaeton/daddy-yankee-dio-un-adelanto-de-su-nuevo-disco-al-fundador-de-zumba|title=Daddy Yankee dio un adelanto de su nuevo disco al fundador de Zumba|publisher=Univisión|language=spanish|last=Miserachi|first=Raquel|date=October 26, 2016|accessdate=October 27, 2016}} On June 21, 2017, Daddy Yankee stated that he postponed the album's release due to finding more successful the release of singles instead of an entire record.{{cite web |url= https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FU-_cDQMvL8|title=Daddy Yankee en directo en "Anda Ya!", 21 de Junio|quote=I was going to release the album but for some reason single after single is working better.|publisher=YouTube|language=Spanish|date=June 21, 2017|accessdate=August 19, 2017}} 17:33–18:06 In December 2014, ''Billboard'' magazine added digital and streaming information to count sales: 1,000 digital songs sales and 1,500 song streams separately equal one album sale, which may affect the chart placement of the album. Considered on-demand audio services includes [[Spotify]], [[Google Play]], [[Beats Music]] and [[Xbox Music]].{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/6320099/billboard-200-makeover-streams-digital-tracks|title=Billboard 200 Makeover: Album Chart to Incorporate Streams & Track Sales|work=Billboard|date=November 19, 2014|accessdate=November 3, 2016}} ===Singles=== {{Listen |filename=Daddy Yankee - Shaky Shaky.ogg |title="Shaky Shaky" |description=A 29-second sample of "[[Shaky Shaky]]". The song blends sounds from old and new school reggaeton. It became a number-one hit single on the US Latin and Tropical Songs charts. |format=[[Ogg]]}} "[[Sígueme y Te Sigo]]" was released as the first single on March 12, 2015. It peaked at number 6 on the US [[Hot Latin Songs]] chart on June 13, 2015 and at number 5 on [[Tropical Songs]] on April 18, 2015.{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/300083/daddy-yankee/chart?page=1&f=363|title=Daddy Yankee – Chart history – Hot Latin Songs|work=Billboard|page=2|accessdate=August 17, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/300083/daddy-yankee/chart?f=340|title=Daddy Yankee – Chart history – Tropical Songs|work=Billboard|page=1|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} Internationally, the song peaked at number 12 in Spain, at number 32 in Venezuela, and at number 198 in France.{{cite web |url=http://www.promusicae.es/listas/semana/2923-canciones-semana-28-2015.pdf |title=Top 100 Canciones – SEMANA 28: del 06.07.2015 al 09.07.2015 |publisher=promusicae.es|language=spanish|accessdate=August 26, 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://national-report.com.ve/wp-content/uploads/TOP-100-DETECCIONES-SEMANAL-31.pdf|title=Top 100 Detecciones Semanal Semana 31 del 2016|publisher=national-report.com.ve|language=spanish|date=September 1, 2016|accessdate=October 21, 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://www.snepmusique.com/tops-semaine/top-singles-telecharges/?ye=2015&we=28 |title=Le Top de la semaine : Top Singles Téléchargés – Semaine du Aout 14, 2015 |publisher=snepmusique.com|language=french|date=August 14, 2015|accessdate=August 26, 2016}} It was certified 2× platinum by the [[PROMUSICAE]], platinum by the IFPI Chile, and gold by the [[Federazione Industria Musicale Italiana|FIMI]].{{cite web |url= http://www.elportaldemusica.es/cancion-10039-18054-daddy-yankee-sigueme-y-te-sigo|title=Daddy Yankee – Sígueme y Te Sigo|publisher=elportaldemusica.es|accessdate=August 19, 2016}}{{cite web |url= http://www.daddyyankee.com/master-71|title=Chile Recibe al Rey del Reggaeton con Triple Disco de Platino por sus sencillos ''Shaky Shaky'', ''Sígueme y Te Sigo'' y ''Vaivén''|publisher=daddyyankee.com|language=spanish|date=November 29, 2016|accessdate=November 29, 2016}}{{cite web |url= http://www.fimi.it/certificazioni#/category:tutte/year:2016/page:0/term:Daddy|title=Federazione Industria Musicale Italiana – Certificazioni – Daddy Yankee 2016|publisher=fimi.it|language=italian|accessdate=January 23, 2017}} "Vaivén" was released as the second single on September 17, 2016. Although the song does not have an official music video, it managed to peak at number 7 on the US Hot Latin Songs chart and at number 3 on Tropical Songs, both on January 23, 2016. Internationally, the single reached number 19 in Spain and number 34 in Venezuela.{{cite web |url=http://www.promusicae.es/listas/semana/3003-canciones-semana-43-2015.pdf|title=Top 100 Canciones – SEMANA 43: del 16.10.2015 al 22.10.2015 |publisher=promusicae.es|language=spanish|accessdate=August 26, 2016}} It received a platinum certification by the PROMUSICAE and the IFPI Chile.{{cite web |url= http://www.elportaldemusica.es/cancion-11030-19571-daddy-yankee-vaiven|title=Daddy Yankee – Vaivén|publisher=elportaldemusica.es|accessdate=August 19, 2016}} "[[Shaky Shaky]]" was released as the third single on April 8, 2016, although it was originally planned as a gift from Yankee to his fans for 2015 Christmas. The song reached the number 1 spot on the US Hot Latin Songs and [[Tropical Songs]] charts on November 5 and August 20, 2016, respectively.{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/300083/daddy-yankee/chart?f=363|title=Daddy Yankee – Chart history – Hot Latin Songs|work=Billboard|page=1|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} It became his fourth No. 1 song on the Hot Latin Songs chart and his first one since February 2013.{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin/7556711/daddy-yankee-hot-latin-songs-shaky-shaky|title=Hitting No. 1, Daddy Yankee Style: Listen to His 4 Biggest Chart Hits|work=Billboard|last=Fernandez|first=Suzette|date=October 25, 2016|accessdate=October 25, 2016}} It also peaked at number 88 in the [[Billboard Hot 100|United States]], becoming Daddy Yankee's first entry on the Hot 100 since the debut of "[[Impacto]]" on May 26, 2007.{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/300083/daddy-yankee/chart?f=379|title=Daddy Yankee – Chart history – The Hot 100|work=Billboard|accessdate=August 17, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/charts/hot-100/2007-05-26|title=The Hot 100 – Week of May 26, 2007|work=Billboard|date=May 26, 2007|accessdate=January 15, 2017}} Internationally, the song peaked at number 1 in Mexico and the Dominican Republic, at number 4 in Colombia, at number 11 in Guatemala, at number 14 in Uruguay, at number 25 in Spain, and at number 42 in Venezuela.International peaks for "Shaky Shaky": *México: {{cite web|url=http://monitorlatino.com/shaky-shaky-sobre-mi-como-no-queriendo-y-let-me-love-you-las-canciones-con-mas-audiencia-en-mexico/|title="Shaky, shaky", "Sobre mí", "Como no queriendo" y "Let me love you" las canciones con más audiencia en México|last=Rivera|first=Nayeli|publisher=Monitor Latino|language=spanish|date=October 3, 2016|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} *Dominican Republic: {{cite web|url=http://monitorlatino.com/daddy-yankee-anthony-santos-jose-montoro-los-mas-sonados-de-republica-dominicana/|title=Daddy Yankee, Anthony Santos, José Montoro los más sonados de República Dominicana|last=Rivera|first=Nayeli|publisher=Monitor Latino|language=spanish|accessdate=April 5, 2017}} *Colombia: {{cite web |url= http://charts.monitorlatino.com/top20/Colombia/General/20160815|title=Top 20 General Colombia: Del 15 al 21 de Agosto, 2016|publisher=Monitor Latino|language=Spanish|accessdate=August 18, 2017}} *Guatemala: {{cite web |url= http://charts.monitorlatino.com/top20/Guatemala/General/20161226|title=Top 20 General Guatemala: Del 26 de Diciembre 2016 al 1 de Enero 2017|publisher=Monitor Latino|language=Spanish|accessdate=August 18, 2017}} *Uruguay: {{cite web |url= http://charts.monitorlatino.com/top20/Uruguay/General/20170206|title=Top 20 General Uruguay: Del 6 al 12 de Febrero, 2017|publisher=Monitor Latino|language=Spanish|accessdate=August 18, 2017}} *Spain: {{cite web |url=http://www.promusicae.es/listas/semana/3286-canciones-semana-46-2016.pdf | title=Top 100 Canciones – SEMANA 46: del 11.11.2016 al 17.11.2016 |publisher=promusicae.es|language=spanish|accessdate=November 24, 2016}} *Venezuela: {{cite web |url=http://national-report.com.ve/wp-content/uploads/TOP-100-DETECCIONES-SEMANAL-2.pdf|title=Top 100 Detecciones Semanal Semana 35 del 2016|publisher=national-report.com.ve|language=spanish|date=August 4, 2016|accessdate=October 20, 2016}} It was certified 2× platinum by the PROMUSICAE and the [[Argentine Chamber of Phonograms and Videograms Producers|CAPIF]], platinum by the IFPI Chile, and gold by the FIMI.{{cite web |url= http://www.elportaldemusica.es/cancion-12403-21873-daddy-yankee-shaky-shaky|title=Daddy Yankee – Shaky Shaky|publisher=elportaldemusica.es|accessdate=August 19, 2016}}{{cite news|url= http://www.billboard.com.ar/noticia/2302/daddy-yankee-el-regreso-del-rey-del-reggaetn|title=Daddy Yankee: el regreso del rey del reggaetón|work=Billboard Argentina|last=Máscolo|first=Santiago|language=Spanish|date=April 17, 2017|accessdate=August 17, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://www.fimi.it/certificazioni#/category:singoli/year:2017/page:0/term:shaky_shaky|title=FIMI – Certificazioni – Shaky Shaky – Daddy Yankee|publisher=fimi.it|accessdate=April 8, 2017}} ====Other releases==== "Sábado Rebelde" was released as a promotional song on October 31, 2014. It features reggaeton duo [[Plan B (duo)|Plan B]] and was written by Daddy Yankee, Plan B, and the producer Haze. It peaked at number 49 on the US Hot Latin Songs chart on February 28, 2015.{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/300083/daddy-yankee/chart?page=3&f=363|title=Daddy Yankee – Chart history – Hot Latin Songs|work=Billboard|page=4|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} "Alerta Roja" was released as a promotional song on Daddy Yankee's birthday on February 3, 2016 as a gift to his fans.{{cite web |url= http://peru.com/entretenimiento/musica/youtube-daddy-yankee-lanzo-su-tema-alerta-roja-15-artistas-noticia-437572|title=YouTube: Daddy Yankee lanzó su tema "Alerta Roja" con 15 artistas|publisher=peru.com|language=spanish|date=February 4, 2016|accessdate=October 28, 2016}} The song's concept was to include some of the most popular Latin urban artists.{{cite web |url= https://www.telemundo.com/entretenimiento/2016/02/04/daddy-yankee-lanza-video-musical-alerta-roja-que-reune-15-artistas|title=Daddy Yankee lanza vídeo musical "Alerta roja" que reúne a 15 artistas urbanos|language=Spanish|publisher=Telemundo|date=February 4, 2016|accessdate=August 19, 2016}} Singers [[Osmani García]] and [[J Álvarez]] (Cuban and Puerto Rican, respectively) were originally guest artists but their verses were not included in the song. J Álvarez stated not knowing about being out of it and manifestated his anger with Daddy Yankee through his social networks.{{cite web |url= http://www.rapeton.com/dejaron-fuera-j-alvarez-en-alerta-roja-pero-el-artista-montara-un-tema-nuevo/|title=Dejaron fuera a J Alvarez en "Alerta Roja" pero el artista montará un tema nuevo con los mismos versos|language=Spanish|publisher=rapeton.com|date=February 3, 2016|accessdate=August 24, 2016}} Two weeks later, Álvarez said that he was not aware of the song's concept and also that his anger was caused by a misunderstanding.{{cite web |url= http://www.primerahora.com/entretenimiento/farandula/nota/jalvarezreaccionaasuliocontranickyjamydaddyyankee-1137213/|title=J Álvarez reacciona a su lío contra Nicky Jam y Daddy Yankee|language=Spanish|publisher=primerahora.com|last=Brugueras|first=Melba|date=February 16, 2016|accessdate=August 24, 2016}} "Otra Cosa" was released as a [[Promotional recording#Promo single|promotional single]] on December 9, 2016 and features [[Natti Natasha]]. The song was released as the first single of [[Pina Records]]' upcoming studio album, ''La Súper Fórmula'', but Daddy Yankee managed to also include it on ''El Disco Duro''. The single peaked at number 21 on the US Hot Latin Songs chart on February 18, 2017 and at number 17 on Tropical Songs on January 14, 2017.{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/300083/daddy-yankee/chart?page=2&f=363|title=Daddy Yankee – Chart history – Hot Latin Songs|work=Billboard|page=3|accessdate=August 17, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/search/charts?f[0]=ss_chart_search_title%3A%22Otra%20Cosa%22&f[1]=itm_field_chart_id%3A374&refine=1|title=''Billboard'' Chart Search – Otra Cosa – Daddy Yankee & Natti Natasha – Hot Latin Songs|work=Billboard|accessdate=August 17, 2017}} The song also peaked at number 50 in Venezuela.{{cite web |url=http://national-report.com.ve/top-100-semana-10-del-03032017-al-09032017/|title=Top 100 – Semana 10 del 03/03/2017 al 09/03/2017|publisher=national-report.com.ve|language=spanish|date=March 10, 2017|accessdate=April 11, 2017}} "La Rompe Corazones" was released as a promotional single on January 6, 2017 as a gift from Daddy Yankee to his fans because of [[Epiphany (holiday)|Three Kings' Day]].{{cite web |url= http://moda.com.pe/noticias/musica/daddy-yankee-ozuna-la-rompe-corazones-video-oficial-25686|title=Escucha lo nuevo de Daddy Yankee y Ozuna: 'La rompe corazones'|language=Spanish|publisher=moda.com.pe|date=January 6, 2017|accessdate=January 6, 2017}} The song peaked at number 12 on the US Hot Latin Songs chart on July 22, 2017. Internationally, the single peaked at number 2 in Peru, at number 8 in Spain and Mexico, and at number 11 in Paraguay.{{cite web |url= http://charts.monitorlatino.com/top20/Peru/General/20170410|title=Top 20 General Perú: Del 10 al 16 de Abril, 2017|publisher=Monitor Latino|language=spanish|accessdate=August 17, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://www.promusicae.es/listas/semana/3375-canciones-semana-11-2017.pdf|title=Top 100 Canciones – SEMANA 11: del 10.03.2017 al 16.03.2017|publisher=promusicae.es|language=spanish|accessdate=March 26, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://charts.monitorlatino.com/top20/Mexico/General/20170807|title=Top 20 General México: Del 7 al 13 de Agosto, 2017|publisher=Monitor Latino|language=spanish|accessdate=August 17, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://charts.monitorlatino.com/top20/Paraguay/General/20170724|title=Top 20 General Paraguay: Del 24 al 30 de Julio, 2017|publisher=Monitor Latino|language=spanish|accessdate=August 18, 2017}} It was certified 2× platinum by the PROMUSICAE and gold by the CAPIF.{{cite web |url= http://www.elportaldemusica.es/cancion-14008-24416-daddy-yankee-ozuna-la-rompe-corazones|title=Daddy Yankee / Ozuna – La Rompe Corazones|publisher=elportaldemusica.es|accessdate=March 16, 2017}} "Hula Hoop" was released as a promotional single on March 3, 2017, originally recorded exclusively for Zumba fitness.{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin/7710074/daddy-yankee-new-song-hula-hoop-zumba-listen|title=Daddy Yankee Delivers New Track 'Hula Hoop' in Partnership With Zumba|work=Billboard|last=Cantor-Navas|first=Judy|date=March 3, 2017|accessdate=August 19, 2017}}{{cite web |url= https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FU-_cDQMvL8|title=Daddy Yankee en directo en "Anda Ya!", 21 de Junio|quote=The song transcended beyond being a gift for zumba.|publisher=YouTube|language=Spanish|date=June 21, 2017|accessdate=August 19, 2017}} 0:15–1:05 The song was based on the "hula hoop" hook from the remix of "Shaky Shaky" by Daddy Yankee, Nicky Jam and Plan B. It peaked at number 30 on the US Hot Latin Songs chart on March 25, 2017. Internationally, it reached number 9 in Chile, number 18 in Venezuela, number 20 in Colombia, and number 75 in Spain.{{cite web |url= http://charts.monitorlatino.com/top20/Chile/General/20170327|title=Top 20 General Chile: Del 27 de Marzo al 2 de Abril, 2017|publisher=Monitor Latino|language=Spanish|accessdate=August 18, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://national-report.com.ve/top-100-semana-16-del-14042017-al-20042017/|title=Top 100 – Semana 16 del 14/04/2017 al 20/04/2017|publisher=national-report.com.ve|language=spanish|date=April 21, 2017|accessdate=April 28, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://charts.monitorlatino.com/top20/Colombia/General/20170403|title=Top 20 General Colombia: Del 3 al 9 de Abril, 2017|publisher=Monitor Latino|language=spanish|accessdate=August 18, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://www.promusicae.es/listas/semana/3395-canciones-semana-15-2017.pdf |title=Top 100 Canciones – SEMANA 15: del 07.04.2017 al 13.04.2017|publisher=promusicae.es|language=spanish|accessdate=April |url= http://www.nbcnews.com/news/latino/your-holiday-weekend-playlist-10-top-latino-songs-get-you-n686801|title=Your Holiday Weekend Playlist: 10 Top Latino Songs to Get You Moving|publisher=[[NBC News]]|last=Hernandez|first=Ericka|date=November 25, 2016|accessdate=January 31, 2017}} |- |''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' |Best Latin Dance Songs of 2016 |"Shaky Shaky" |2016 |{{center|1}} |{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/events/year-in-music-2016/7616876/latin-dance-year-end-list-daddy-yankee-shakira|title=All We Want to Do Is Dance: Daddy Yankee, Shakira, Nicky Jam & More Latin Artists Who Got Fans Dancing in 2016|publisher=Billboard|last=Cobo|first=Leila|date=December 13, 2016|accessdate=January 31, 2017}} |- |''[[PopSugar]]'' |30 Songs That Pretty Much Defined Latin Music in 2016 |"Shaky Shaky" |2016 |{{center|19}} |{{cite web |url= http://www.popsugar.com/latina/Best-Latin-Songs-2016-42692301?stream_view=1#photo-42692620|title=30 Songs That Pretty Much Defined Latin Music in 2016|publisher=[[PopSugar]]|last=Martin|first=Macy Daniela|date=December 31, 2016|accessdate=January 31, 2017}} |} "Sígueme y Te Sigo" received a Latin American Music Award for Favorite Urban Song at the [[Latin American Music Awards of 2015|1st Latin American Music Awards]]. It was nominated for [[Latin Grammy Awards]] for [[Latin Grammy Award for Best Urban Song|Best Urban Song]] and [[Latin Grammy Award for Best Urban Performance|Best Urban Performance]] at the [[16th Annual Latin Grammy Awards|16th Latin Grammy Awards]].{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin/6722629/latin-amas-2015-winners-list|title=Latin AMAs Winners List: Enrique Iglesias & Nicky Jam Win Big at Inaugural Awards Show|work=Billboard|last=Cobo|first=Leila|date=October 8, 2015|accessdate=April 29, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/events/latin-awards/6770030/latin-grammys-2015-winners-list|title=Latin Grammys 2015: See the Full Winners List|work=Billboard|date=November 19, 2015|accessdate=April 28, 2017}} "Vaivén" was nominated for an [[Winter Music Conference#Events|International Dance Music Award]] for Best Latin Dance Track at the 31st International Dance Music Awards and for a [[Lo Nuestro Award for Urban Song of the Year]] at the 29th Lo Nuestro Awards.{{cite web |url= http://wintermusicconference.com/events/idmas/index.php?wmcyear=2016#idmanominees|title=IDMA Winners for the year 2015 presented in 2016|publisher=[[Winter Music Conference]]|accessdate=April 29, 2017}} "Shaky Shaky" received a [[Premios Juventud|Premio Juventud]] for Best Song for Dancing at the [[2017 Premios Juventud|14th Premios Juventud]].{{cite web |url= http://www.univision.com/especiales/premios-juventud/estos-son-los-ganadores-de-los-premios-juventud-2017|title=Estos son los ganadores de los Premios Juventud 2017|trans-title=These are the winners for the Premios Juventud 2017|publisher=[[Univision]]|language=Spanish|date=July 6, 2017|accessdate=July 7, 2017}} It was nominated for [[Billboard Latin Music Awards|''Billboard'' Latin Music Awards]] for Hot Latin Song of the Year and Streaming Song of the Year at the 24th ''Billboard'' Latin Music Awards.{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin/7678227/billboard-latin-music-awards-2017-see-the-full-list-of-finalists|title=Billboard Latin Music Awards 2017: See the Full List of Finalists |work=Billboard|last=Cobo|first=Leila|date=February 7, 2017|accessdate=February 12, 2017}} It also received a [[Billboard Music Award for Top Latin Song|Top Latin Song]] nomination at the [[2017 Billboard Music Awards|24th ''Billboard'' Music Awards]].{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/bbma/7752631/billboard-music-awards-2017-nominations-full-list|title=Drake, The Chainsmokers Lead Nominees for the 2017 Billboard Music Awards|work=Billboard|date=April 10, 2017|accessdate=April 11, 2017}} ==Track listing== To be announced. revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=May 2009}} {{Infobox person | name = Fritz Muliar | image = Fritz Muliar (left) and unknown person.jpg | caption = Fritz Muliar (left) | birth_name = Friedrich Ludwig Stand | birth_date = {{birth date|1919|12|12|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Vienna]] | death_date = {{death date and age|2009|05|04|1919|12|12|mf=y}} | death_place = Vienna | occupation = Actor | spouse = | website = }} '''Fritz Muliar''', born as '''Friedrich Ludwig Stand''' (December 12, 1919 – May 4, 2009), was an [[Austria]]n actor who, due to his huge popularity, is often referred to by his countrymen as ''Volksschauspieler''.
== Biography == Born in [[Neubau]], [[Vienna]] as the stepson of a [[jewellery|jeweller]], Muliar became a [[cabaret]] artist in the late 1930s. He was a [[Boy Scout]] in his youth.<ref name= "Pfade">{{cite journal|author= | title =Eingeschlagene Pfade|language = German | journal = Skills-100 Jahre Pfadfinder.Magazin zum Abenteuer des Lebens.|pages=104–105| date = | year = 2007|publisher= Pfadfinder und Pfadfinderinnen Österreichs und Monopol Verlag }}</ref><ref name="Dabei">{{cite journal|author=Kati Kieser;Lisa Niederdorfer | title =Dabei gewesen|language = German | journal = Skills-Pfadfinderinnen und Aussen.Magazin zum Abenteuer des Lebens.|pages=66–67|year = 2010|publisher= Pfadfinder und Pfadfinderinnen Österreichs und Monopol Verlag }}</ref> After serving in the [[World War II|Second World War]], he was imprisoned by the [[Nazism|Nazis]] in 1942 and spent seven months in [[solitary confinement]] for ''Betätigung zur Wiederherstellung eines freien Österreich'' (activities to restore Austrian independence—'''see''' [[Anschluss]]).
After the war, Muliar started his career as a stage actor. Of small build, he once said that his ambitions had never included playing parts such as that of [[Othello]]. Rather, he had always preferred comic roles and traditional Austrian fare ([[Johann Nestroy]], [[Ferdinand Raimund]]). Muliar also excelled in imitating various [[Accent (dialect)|accent]]s, in particular those used by [[Czech language|Czech]] and [[Yiddish]] speakers of [[German language|German]]. In 1990, he had enormous success in [[Felix Mitterer]]'s play for one person, ''[[Siberia (play)|Siberia]]'' (televised in 1991), a study in [[ageism]] about an old man who has been abandoned by his family in a [[retirement home]] and his struggle for [[dignity]].
While he also performed regularly at the [[Salzburg Festival]] in the play ''[[Jedermann (play)|Jedermann]]'' (a version of ''[[Everyman (play)|Everyman]]''), Muliar was associated with two Viennese theatres in particular: the [[Burgtheater]] (whose [[tenure]]d member he was until his retirement), and the [[Theater in der Josefstadt]], where he worked until his death in 2009. He was one of the severest critics of [[Claus Peymann]] (born 1937), director of the Burgtheater between 1986 and 1999 whose leadership polarized Austrian theatregoers by its focus on controversial playwrights such as [[Thomas Bernhard]] and [[Elfriede Jelinek]]. [[Musical theatre]] saw Muliar in the non-singing role of Frosch in ''[[Die Fledermaus]]''. At Theater in der Josefstadt, Muliar was perhaps best known for the role of Mr. Green in [[Jeff Baron]]'s [[Visiting Mr. Green]] (Besuch bei Mr Green). Muliar, Michael Dangl the theater and Jeff Baron were awarded the 2001 Kulturpreis Europa for this production, which ran for several seasons and was nationally telecast.
Muliar appeared in numerous films and in some television series such as ''[[Kir Royal – Aus dem Leben eines Klatschreporters|Kir Royal]]'' (alongside [[Franz Xaver Kroetz]]) and ''[[Kommissar Rex]]''. He is best remembered beyond the boundaries of his native Vienna for playing the title role in the 13-part TV series, ''[[The Good Soldier Svejk|Die Abenteuer des braven Soldaten Schwejk]]'', which was filmed in [[German language|German]] and broadcast by the [[Austria]]n state TV ([[ORF (broadcaster)|ORF]]) in 1972.
Muliar was a committed [[Social Democrat]] who publicly supported various Austrian [[Social Democratic Party of Austria|Social Democratic]] politicians during their [[election campaign]]s. He was married from 1955 to [[Franziska Kalmar]], Austria's first [[television presenter]]. In January 2006 he was elected to the position of a public advisor in the Austrian state TV (ORF). He died in Vienna, aged 89.
==Awards== * [[Decoration for Services to the Liberation of Austria]] * Gold Medal for services to the City of Vienna * Medal of the Austrian Broadcasting Corporation * [[Professor#Other professors 2|Professor]] by the Republic of Austria (1975) * [[Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany|Merit Cross 1st Class of the Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany]] (1977) * [[:de:Kainz-Medaille|Kainz Medal]] for Peachum in [[Bertolt Brecht]]'s ''[[Three Penny Opera]]'' (1978) * [[:de:Nestroy-Ring|Nestroy Ring]] (1984) * [[Austrian Cross of Honour for Science and Art, 1st class]] (1984) * [[Gold Medal of Styria]] (1985) * Kammerschauspieler ("Chamber actor") (1985) * [[Gold Medal of Salzburg]] (1989) * Naming of a street in Grossenzersdorf after Fritz Muliar in 1994 * Honorary member of the [[Burgtheater]] (1995) * Honorary member of the [[Theater in der Josefstadt]] (1996) * Ring of Honour of the City of Vienna (1999) * European Culture Prize (2001) * [[Grand Decoration of Honour in Silver for Services to the Republic of Austria]] (2002)<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.parlament.gv.at/PAKT/VHG/XXIV/AB/AB_10542/imfname_251156.pdf | title = Reply to a parliamentary question | language = German | page=1483 |trans-title=| format = pdf | accessdate = 20 November 2012 }}</ref> * Grand Golden Decoration for services to the province of Lower Austria (2002) * Platinum [[Romy (TV award)|Romy]] for lifetime achievement (2004) * Ferdinand Raimund-Ring 2008 * Ring of honour of Grossenzersdorf
== References == {{Reflist}}
== External links == * {{IMDb name|id=0611869|name=Fritz Muliar}} * [http://www.kfe.de/index.php?navi=2&submenu=2&year=2001]
{{Authority control}}

revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=April 2014}} {{Infobox video game |title=Fury | image = FuryGameLogo.jpg | developer = [[Auran]] | publisher = [[Gamecock Media Group]] | designer = Auran |composer=[[Pedro Camacho]]{{Citation|author=MobyGames|title=Fury credits page at mobygames.com|url=http://www.mobygames.com/game/windows/fury_/credits|accessdate=28 December 2008}} | engine = [[Unreal Engine#Unreal Engine 3|Unreal Engine 3.0]]
Foliage: [[SpeedTree]][http://blog.speedtree.com/wp-content/uploads/news/PR_Auran_Licenses_SpeedTreeRT_June_21_06.pdf "Auran's ''Fury'' to feature SpeedTreeRT], press release, 21 June 2006, speedtree.com | released = October 16, 2007 | genre = [[Massively multiplayer online role-playing game|MMORPG]] | modes = [[Multiplayer video game|Multiplayer]] | platforms = [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] }} '''''Fury''''' was a [[player versus player]] (PvP) competitive online role-playing game and [[massively multiplayer online role-playing game]] (MMORPG) developed by [[Auran]]. The game was published by Gamecock Media Group on October 16, 2007, and was the first game they published.{{cite news|last1=GameSpot Staff|title=Auran's Fury shuts down|url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/aurans-fury-shuts-down/1100-6195434/|accessdate=February 9, 2017|work=[[GameSpot]]|date=August 5, 2008}} Less than two months later, the developer announced it had laid off all employees. The game switched to a free-to-play model, but in October 2008 Auran shutdown the game servers meaning the game would no longer be playable. ==Gameplay== ''Fury''{{'s}} focus on PvP combat differentiated it from traditional RPGs that center around [[player versus environment]] (PvE) content against [[non-player character]]s. However, like most RPGs, ''Fury'' used collectible equipment, skills, and a ranking mechanism for players. ''Fury'' used a method of matching equally ranked players from across the world in PvP matches.{{Citation needed|date=June 2009}} ''Fury'' further differentiated itself from traditional RPGs by making many of its [[magic (gaming)|spells]] and abilities activate instantly and lacking a [[cooldown]] period. The pace of gameplay thus tended to be faster than PvP combat in traditional RPGs. For example, spell-casters in ''Fury'' were sometimes not frozen in place when casting a spell, which allowed them to retreat and avoid obstacles that might otherwise have locked them in. ==Development== The game was initially well received in beta testing and during a pre-release event known as the ''Fury Challenge''; however, many aspects of the game were changed before the public release. At the beginning of 2008, a large change was made to the game mechanics and the business plan of ''Fury''. This made the game completely free to play, with the option of upgrading to the two previous payment options: retail price (a one-time fee), and Immortal (monthly payments). Additionally, all players prior to this large patch were given Immortal status free for life. A new business plan was drafted late in the game's life which attempted to save the game. This plan included a match limit for free players and the possibility for skilled players to turn their skill into cash; however, the servers shut down before this plan was ever implemented. ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | GR = 53.65% | MC = 55/100 | GSpot = 4.5/10 | IGN = 6.5/10 | GRadar = {{Rating|3.5|5}}{{Cite web |url=http://www.gamesradar.com/fury-review/ |title=Fury review |publisher=[[GamesRadar]] |last=Joynt-Borger |first=Sarah |date=24 October 2007 |accessdate=26 December 2017}} | GSpy = {{Rating|2.5|5}}{{Cite web |url=http://pc.gamespy.com/pc/fury/837042p1.html |title=GameSpy: Fury |publisher=[[GameSpy]] |last=Villoria |first=Gerald |date=21 November 2007 |accessdate=26 December 2017}} | GI = 5/10{{Cite web |url=http://gameinformer.com/NR/exeres/EB3257CC-5624-4EC6-B61D-44BBFD67A8DA.htm |title=KTHXBAI |publisher=[[Game Informer]] |last1=Biessener |first1=Adam |last2=Juba |first2=Joe |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071130170916/http://gameinformer.com/NR/exeres/EB3257CC-5624-4EC6-B61D-44BBFD67A8DA.htm |archivedate=30 November 2007 |accessdate=26 December 2017}} | EuroG = 3/10{{Cite web |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/fury-review |title=Fury |publisher=[[Eurogamer]] |last=Fahey |first=Rob |date=20 November 2007 |accessdate=26 December 2017}} | GameZone = 4.6/10{{Cite web |url=http://pc.gamezone.com/gzreviews/r29411.htm |title=Fury Review - PC |publisher=GameZone |last=David |first=Mike |date=5 November 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071106160805/http://pc.gamezone.com/gzreviews/r29411.htm |archivedate=6 November 2007 |accessdate=26 December 2017}} }} ''Fury'' received below average reviews from major gaming websites, having a score of 53.65% on [[GameRankings]]{{Cite web |url=http://www.gamerankings.com/pc/932997-fury/index.html |title=Fury for PC |publisher=[[GameRankings]] |accessdate=26 December 2017}} and a score of 55/100 on [[Metacritic]].{{Cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/fury |title=Fury for PC Reviews |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=26 December 2017}} [[GameSpot]] gave the game 4.5 out of 10, highlighting its poorly optimized engine, and its clumsy and chaotic gameplay.{{Cite web |url=http://www.gamespot.com/pc/rpg/fury/review.html |title=Fury for PC Review |publisher=[[GameSpot]] |last=VanOrd |first=Kevin |date=2 November 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201113259/http://www.gamespot.com/pc/rpg/fury/review.html |archivedate=1 December 2008 |accessdate=26 December 2017}} [[IGN]] gave a 6.5 out of 10, however ultimately criticized similar concepts, such as excessive numbers of useless skills, too many NPCs and minimal longevity.{{Cite web |url=http://pc.ign.com/articles/830/830124p1.html |title=IGN: Fury Review |publisher=[[IGN]] |last=Onyett |first=Charles |date=24 October 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071026102031/http://pc.ign.com/articles/830/830124p1.html |archivedate=26 October 2007 |accessdate=26 December 2017}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fury (Video Game)}} [[Category:Massively multiplayer online role-playing games]] [[Category:2007 video games]] [[Category:Products and services discontinued in 2008]] [[Category:Inactive massively multiplayer online games]] [[Category:Unreal Engine games]] [[Category:Video games developed in Australia]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Windows-only games]]

revision.text: {{More citations needed|date=December 2008}} {{Infobox website | name = GOOG-411 | logo = Goog411 Logo.png | caption = | url = [https://web.archive.org/web/20071014091650/https://www.google.com/goog411/ google.com/goog411] | commercial = | type = [[Search engine technology|search]] | language = English | registration = No | owner = [[Google]] | author = Google | launch date = {{start date and age|2007|4|6}} | dissolved = {{end date|2010|11|12}} | current status = Discontinued | revenue = }} '''GOOG-411''' (or '''Google Voice Local Search''') was a [[telephone]] service launched by [[Google]] in 2007, that provided a [[speech recognition|speech-recognition]]-based business [[directory assistance|directory search]], and placed a [[phone call|call]] to the resulting [[phone number|number]] in the [[United States]] or [[Canada]].{{cite web|url=https://www.google.com/goog411/about.html |title=1-800-GOOG-411: Find and connect with local businesses for free from your phone. |publisher=[[Google]] |accessdate=2009-03-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090227084550/https://www.google.com/goog411/about.html |archivedate=February 27, 2009 }} The service was accessible via a [[toll-free telephone number]]. It was an alternative to [[4-1-1]], an often-expensive service provided by [[local exchange carrier|local]] and [[long-distance calling|long-distance]] [[phone companies]], and was therefore commonly known as '''Google 411'''. This service was discontinued on November 12, 2010.{{cite web|author= |url=http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2010/10/goodbye-to-old-friend-1-800-goog-411.html |title=Official Blog: Goodbye to an old friend: 1-800-GOOG-411 |publisher=Googleblog.blogspot.com |date=2010-10-08 |accessdate=2013-11-07}} ==History== GOOG 411 had been assisting people with obtaining phone numbers since 2007. On November 12, 2010, GOOG-411 shut down its service. While Google did not provide an official reason for the shut down, many believe that Google had simply gathered enough voice samples for its research purposes.{{cite web|last=Chitu |first=Alex |url=http://googlesystem.blogspot.com/2010/10/google-shuts-down-goog-411.html |title=Google Shuts Down GOOG-411 |publisher=Googlesystem.blogspot.com |date=2010-10-09 |accessdate=2013-11-07}}{{cite web|author= |url=http://buildcontext.com/blog/2011/the-411-parable |title="The 411 Parable": Make sure you are playing the same game. < blog :: buildcontext the personal blog of Ben Hedrington |publisher=Buildcontext.com |date=2011-05-03 |accessdate=2013-11-07}} Google also operated a similar service from SMS number 466453 which has also been discontinued. ==Operations== Users who called the [[toll-free telephone number]]s 800-466-4411 or 877-466-4411 (800-GOOG-411 and 877-GOOG-411) or the local number [[area code 425|425]]-296-4774{{cite web |url= http://mobile.google.com/support/bin/answer.py?answer=114953 |title= Using : Corporate or commercial users - Mobile Help |publisher= [[Google]] |accessdate= November 5, 2009 |deadurl= yes |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20091211121927/http://mobile.google.com/support/bin/answer.py?answer=114953 |archivedate= December 11, 2009 |df= }} were asked for the city and state of the sought business. Users were also able to search for by business name or category, which generated a list of up to eight search results. Search was also invoked by using the [[keypad]] if the user preferred. This worked in a similar manner to [[predictive text]] input on a [[cellular phone]]. Users were able to select the destination by speaking or pressing the number that corresponded to the desired result. Once the destination was selected, the service placed a call to the business or returned a [[short message service|text message]] with the phone number. Alternatively, users were able to listen to the [[street address]] and phone number by saying "details". U.S. users could narrow search results by [[ZIP code]] or street [[intersection (road)|intersection]]. Although Google's [[FAQ]] stated that users were able to prevent their phone number from being saved by blocking their [[caller ID]], this is ineffective when calling the 800 number (due to [[Automatic Number Identification|ANI]]) and only works when calling the other two.this can be verified by pressing * at the opening message The service announced that the [[call recording software|call may be recorded]] for the purpose of service improvements. Google advised users not to use the service for [[emergency call]]s, recommending that they call [[9-1-1]].{{cite web|url=http://mobile.google.com/support/bin/answer.py?answer=91565&topic=13551 |title=Overview: Emergency Calls |publisher=Google Inc. |accessdate=2009-03-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081214204654/http://mobile.google.com/support/bin/answer.py?answer=91565&topic=13551 |archivedate=December 14, 2008 }} ==Business model== Google had stated that the company originally implemented GOOG-411 to build a large [[phoneme]] database from users' voice queries. This phoneme database, in turn, allowed Google engineers to refine and improve the speech recognition engine that Google uses to index audio content for searching.{{cite web|last=Carlos |first=Juan |url=http://www.infoworld.com/archives/emailPrint.jsp?R=printThis&A=/article/07/10/23/Google-wants-your-phonemes_1.html |title=Google wants your phonemes | Data management |publisher=InfoWorld |date=2007-10-23 |accessdate=2013-11-07}} ==See also== * [[1-800-FREE-411]] * [[800-The-Info]] * [[Bing Mobile]] * [[List of speech recognition software]] * [[Tellme Networks]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Google Inc.}} [[Category:Discontinued Google services]] [[Category:Telephony]] [[Category:Telephone numbers in Canada]] [[Category:Telephone numbers in the United States]] [[Category:Directory assistance services]] [[Category:Internet properties established in 2007]] [[Category:Internet properties disestablished in 2010]]

revision.comment: /* In song lyrics */ corrected [[The Marshall Mathers LP]] as being Eminem's third album
revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=December 2017}}
'''Homophobia in hip hop culture''' is the homophobic attitude from [[Hip hop music|hip hop]] artists towards [[LGBT people]], in the form of song lyrics that use [[Anti-gay slogan|anti-gay slurs]] and normalize [[violence against LGBT people]].
In 1979, the [[Sugarhill Gang]] released "[[Rapper’s Delight]]", which is the first hip hop record to become a top 40 hit. Although their homophobia was minuscule{{According to whom|date=May 2017}} compared to other rappers in hip hop, “Rapper’s Delight” did exhibit slights to fictional character Superman, who was referred to as a “fairy” for wearing a tight suit.
In 1986, the hip hop trio [[Beastie Boys]] originally wanted to name their debut album ''Don’t Be A Faggot'', but their record label [[Columbia Records]] refused to release it under that title, so it changed to ''[[Licensed To Ill]]''. Years later, the Beastie Boys formally apologized to the [[LGBT community]] for the “shitty and ignorant” things they said on their first record.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://globalgrind.com/1889805/hip-hops-history-homophobia-list-videos/|title=Hip-Hop’s History Of Homophobia (LIST)|author=|date=September 18, 2012|website=GlobalGrind.com|access-date=May 12, 2017}}</ref>
== In song lyrics == Ice-T stated on his autobiography that record-label executive [[Seymour Stein]] took the exception to a homophobic line in his song "409": "''Guys grab a girl, girls grab a guy/If a guy wants a guy, please take it outside''".<ref name="Ice">{{cite book |last1=Marrow |first1=Tracy |authorlink1= |last2=Century |first2=Douglas |title=Ice: A Memoir of Gangster Life and Redemption—from South Central to Hollywood |year=2011 |publisher=Random House |isbn=978-0-345-52328-0 |pages=100-101 }}</ref> Ice-T later became one of the first rappers to condemn homophobia on raps such as ''Straight Up Nigga'' and ''The Tower'' in his album ''[[OG Original Gangster]]''.
Many songs by rapper [[Eminem]] have been considered homophobic for his frequent use of anti-gay slurs, especially the song "Criminal" from his third album ''[[The Marshall Mathers LP]]'' (2000), which containing lines like: "My words are like a dagger with a jagged edge, That'll stab you in the head, whether you're a fag or lez. pants or dress? Hate fags? The answer's 'yes'". In an interview with [[Anderson Cooper]] on ''[[60 Minutes]]'', Eminem denies being homophobic and explained the frequent use of the slur "faggot" in his lyrics, that this word was "thrown around constantly" in battle rapping and he does not refer it to gay people.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121024025240/http://www.towleroad.com/2010/10/eminem-discusses-homophobic-lyrics-with-anderson-cooper.html|title=Eminem Discusses Homophobic Lyrics With Anderson Cooper- News - Towleroad|date=24 October 2012|website=Web.archive.org|accessdate=24 December 2017}}</ref> The album ''The Marshall Mathers LP'' was nominated for [[Album of the Year (Grammy)|Album of the Year]] by the [[Grammy Awards 2001]], which leads to protests due to the album's controversial content. At the show, Eminem performed "[[Stan (song)|Stan]]" with openly gay musician [[Elton John]] as response.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/elton-john-eminem-homophobia_us_58d519ace4b03787d3573e58|title=Elton John Defends Eminem Against Charges Of Homophobia|first=Cavan|last=Sieczkowski|date=24 March 2017|accessdate=24 December 2017|publisher=[[Huff Post]]}}</ref>
In the lyrics of one song on rapper [[Trick-Trick]]'s 2008 album ''[[The Villain (album)|The Villain]]'', he refers to [[Ellen DeGeneres]] and [[Rosie O'Donnell]] as "dyke bitches" and says he will send a "scud missile right through their fucking cruise ship". Trick-Trick expressed his dislike towards homosexuals in an interview with music site [[AllHipHop]]: “Faggots hate me and I don’t give a fuck. I don’t want your faggot money any goddam way.”.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.towleroad.com/2008/11/us-rapper-trick/|title=U.S. Rapper Trick Trick Tells Gays Not to Buy His Homophobic Album - Towleroad|author=|date=November 12, 2008|website=Towleroad.com|access-date=May 12, 2017}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.huffingtonpost.com/peter-souleo-wright/homophobia-in-hip-hop_b_3685094.html ''Homophobia in Hip-Hop'' – [[The Huffington Post]]]
[[Category:Hip hop]] [[Category:Homophobia]] [[Category:LGBT portrayals in media]] [[Category:Sexual orientation and society]]
{{Hiphop-stub}}

revision.comment: also found more widely - add ref.
revision.text:
[[File:Game of Hounds and Jackals MET DP264105.jpg|thumb|Hounds and Jackals board, found at Thebes, 13th Dynasty]] '''Hounds and Jackals''' is the modern name given to an [[Ancient Egypt]]ian game, that is known from several examples of [[board game|gaming boards]] and gaming pieces found in excavations. The modern name was invented by [[Howard Carter]], who found one complete gaming set in a [[Thebes, Egypt|Theban]] tomb that dates to the [[13th Dynasty]]. The latter game set is one of the best preserved examples and is today in the [[Metropolitan Museum of Art]] in New York.<ref>[[William C. Hayes]]: ''The Scepter of Egypt, I. From the Earliest Times to the End of the Middle Kingdom'', New York 1953 {{ISBN|0-87099-190-6}}, 250, fig. 160</ref> He called it ''Hounds contra Jackals''. Another modern name for this game, but not so often used is '''fifty-eight holes'''.<ref name=vaturi>Anne Elizabeth Dunn-Vaturi: ''Game of Hounds and Jackals'', in: A. Oppenheim, d. Arnold, D. Arnold, Kei Yamamoto (editors): ''Ancient Egypt Transformed, The Middle Kingdom'', New York 2015 {{ISBN|978-1-58839-564-1}}, 249, no. 188</ref>
The gaming board has two sets of 29 holes. Gaming pieces are ten small sticks with either jackal or dog heads. The aim of the game was perhaps to start at one point on the board and to reach with all figures another point on the board. The game appeared in Egypt, around 2000 BC and was mainly popular in the [[Middle Kingdom of Egypt|Middle Kingdom]].<ref name=vaturi/> However, it is also known from Mesopotamia and the Caucasus.<ref name = "Bower2018">{{cite journal |last1= Bower|first1= B.|title= A Bronze Age game called 58 holes was found chiseled into stone in Azerbaijan|journal= [[Science News]]|volume= 194|issue= |pages= |date= 2018-11-16|url= https://www.sciencenews.org/article/bronze-age-game-found-chiseled-stone-azerbaijan|access-date= 2018-11-19}}</ref> In the 1956 movie [[The Ten Commandments (1956 film)|''The 10 Commandments'']], Pharaoh Seti and Nefretiri are depicted playing the game.
==See also== * [[Cribbage]] which uses a similar board.
== References == {{Commons category|Hounds and Jackals (Game)}} <references/>
==External links== * [http://www.tradgames.org.uk/games/Hounds-And-Jackals.htm Hounds And Jackals- History and Useful Information]
{{tables games}}
[[Category:History of board games]] [[Category:Ancient Egyptian culture]] [[Category:Race games]] [[Category:Traditional board games]] [[Category:African games]] [[Category:Collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art]]
